title: Saint Croix National Scenic Riverway: News Releases
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     News     News Releases               News Releases           Subscribe  | What is RSS     July 15, 2016  Flood Conditions  To protect public safety, river landings along the Namekagon and St. Croix rivers are closed due to flood conditions.   June 13, 2016  Upcoming Sunday Morning Coffee Walks  Get active and enjoy the outdoors with a park ranger on these walks (coffee provided!) on every other Sunday through October 16.   April 26, 2016  "Watershed" Art Exhibit Now on Display at the St. Croix River Visitor Center  "Watershed," an exhibit featuring the work of 21 local artists, is now on display at the St. Croix River Visitor Center. The artwork includes photography, painting, ceramics, and fiber arts.   April 04, 2016  Registration Open for 2016 "Paddle with a Ranger" Programs  Find Your Park along the St. Croix and Namekagon rivers in 2016 by joining a "Paddle with a Ranger" program. Registration for these unique experiences is open now!   September 02, 2015  River Parks Welcome 4th Grade Students  The Mississippi National River and Recreation Area and the St. Croix National Scenic Riverway are inviting all 4th grade students to visit their parks as part of the White House's new Every Kid in a Park program. Starting now, 4th grade students can go to www.everykidinapark.gov to complete an activity and obtain a free annual entry pass to more than 2,000 federal recreation areas, including national parks.
